intro: Myrsine leuconeura f. catharinensis, commonly known as the Brazilian myrsine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by orange-red berries. It is native to Brazil and thrives in tropical and subtropical regions with high humidity. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
